intro: Boronia pilosa subsp. pilosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in woodland or heathland environments. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants. Boronia pilosa subsp. pilosa is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
